Scan Card#

baecon.GUI.cards.scan_card.add_scan_dialog(meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Pop-up dialog to input scan settings for a new scan.

Parameters:

  • gui_config (gui_utils.GUI_Measurement_Configuration) – _description_

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – _description_

baecon.GUI.cards.scan_card.choose_settings(selected_settings: dict) → dict#

Choose the values for the scan. The input fields are bound to the values in the selected_settings dict. The GUI input fields are given labels based on the keys in selected_settings; this is necessary to properly bind the values. :param selected_settings: Dictionary of scan settings to add. :type selected_settings: dict

Returns:

Scan settings to add.

Return type:

dict

baecon.GUI.cards.scan_card.get_points(selected_settings: dict, scan_key: str)#

Choose whether input field for scan points is the step size or number of points. If input is points, an array of from min to max is made using the given number of points. If input is step_size, an array from min to max is made with the given step size. Number of points generatred for step size is rounded to nearest integer, leading the actual step size to be slight different from the input value. :param selected_settings: Scan settings to add. :type selected_settings: dict :param scan_key: The key for accessing the value in the scan settings

dictionary. In this function, scan_key should always be points.

baecon.GUI.cards.scan_card.update_table()#

Updates the can scan table. The scan table, a ui.aggrid object, is held in the global variable scan_table_holder. Columns and rows are accessed through the options attribute of ui.aggrid.
